predicate.note: Frames file for 'multiply' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

role.descr: amount increased by, EXT or MNR

example.name: mathematical
example.text: But he cautioned that Westmoreland's third quarter is typically better than the fourth, so investors ``shouldn't just multiply the third quarter by four'' and assume the same rate of improvement can be sustained.

example.name: careful with passives
example.text: The uncertainty was multiplied *trace* by the persistent strength of the dollar, traders said.
example.arg: the persistent strength of the dollar

example.name: also ergative
example.text: But such highly leveraged transactions seemed *trace* to have multiplied this year, casting a pall over much of the junk market.
example.arg: casting a pall over much of the junk market

predicate.note: I'm rather doubting now that start and end points will be mentioned, making this verb more analogous to the 'mathematics' sense of 'add' than the 'increase' set of verbs.
